post.summary:
Api for sending the user a continue claim process email notification or already claimed notification
depending on the user's account claim status.
post.description:
If the user account is not claimed, the continue claim notification is sent for the claim process.
If the user is claimed, the Identity Already Claimed Notification is sent for the claim process.
The PORTAL_URL substitution value is required for Continue Claim Notification.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: UserId of the user claiming their account.

post.summary: Api for obtaining the list of values associated with the screen element.
post.description:
This API should be called only when the ScreenElement.valueType is not "InputValue".
The list of values will be generated from the Product Attribute configuration of the attribute
associated with this element. The DetailScreensRuntime API should be called prior to calling this API
to see if the value list depends on other Product Attribute values.
These values can be obtained from the DetailScreen.elements[x].attribute.references.values
of the API. If the value list is dependent, then the UserId of the user whose values should be
substituted (for example a manager) or actual dependent Product Attribute values must be supplied when making this
call. Note, if the screen element values are defined as static in the Product Attribute configuration, then
the DetailScreensRuntime API will have already returned the values for this element as part of the screen
definition.

by AccountId is in a system that qualifies for a password reset configuration, then the
password must meet the password content rules defined in the configuration before the password
will be reset.  An error will be returned if the password does not meet the password content
rules if they are configured.

priority.description:
Password enforcement configurations are created with an assigned priority. Password
policies in higher priority enforcement configuration will be set as the enforced password policy
when a user qualifies for multiple enforcement configurations. Two password enforcement
configurations cannot have the same priority. Priority value range is from 1 to 100 with 100 as the
highest priority.

syncPasswords.description:
Flag that indicates that, if the connected systems account of a user in a password enforcement have a common
password.

mutuallyExclusive.description:
Flag that indicates that the end user cannot use the same password to reset connected system accounts belonging to
different enforcements.

notifyDaysAtSelfServiceLogin.description: Notify user that the password is about to expire X day(s) before expiry at Self-Service login.

description.example: PEC Policy with simple password policy

displayName.description: Display name of the password enforcement. This is a locale aware property.

enabled.description:
Flag that indicates if the password enforcement is enabled. Only enabled enforcements will be
evaluated during the password enforcement evaluation for a user.

name.description: Name of the password enforcement.

PasswordEnforcement.description: Details about the password policy enforcement.

systemId.description: The id of a connected system that is a member of this reset configuration.

notifyDaysAtSelfServiceLogin.description:
The number of days before expiration that the user should be notified via a login alert that
their password is about to expire.

passwordPolicyId.description:
The id of the password reset policy that defines the password content rules that must be
met when the password is reset.

syncPasswords.description:
A flag that indicates whether all systems in the reset configuration should share the same
password.  If true, when the password is reset, all user accounts in the systems defined
in the configuration will have their password reset to the new value.  If false, only the
accounts that the user selected in the reset configuration will have their password reset.

mutuallyExclusive.description:
A flag that indicates whether the same password can be used across multiple reset configurations.
If true, a user may not attempt to reset their password for two systems that are in different
reset configurations to the same value.  If false, the user may use the same password across
different configurations.

scramblePasswordOnExpiry.description:
A flag that indicates whether the Identity system should reset the password to a randomly
generated password for any accounts in this reset configuration that have expired.  If true,
accounts that have expired passwords will be reset.  If false, the expired account will be
left alone.

primary.description:
A flag that indicates this is the primary system in the reset configuration.  Accounts on the
primary system will be reset first.  If the system is unable to reset the password for the
primary system accounts, then it will not attempt to reset the passwords of any accounts in
the remaining systems in the reset configuration.

visible.description:
A flag that indicates whether the user should see this system when accounts and systems are
displayed as part of the reset password user interface.

userGroupIds.description: The list of user group ids that define the set of users who qualify for this reset configuration.

passwordResetRequestorNotificationId.description:
The reset password notification id where the notification is sent after a Self-Service password is reset by the
requestor.

displayName.description: The display name of the reset configuration.  This is a locale aware property.

enabled.description:
A flag that indicates whether this reset configuration is active.  If false, the password policy
should not be enforced when a user tries to reset a password in this configuration.  Setting this
to false may also change the evaluation process and cause the user to qualify for another reset
configuration that has the same system in it with a lower priority.

name.description: The name of the password reset configuration.

priority.description:
The priority of this password reset configuration.  The priority is used to resolve situations where
a system is defined in multiple reset configurations and the user qualifies for both.  The system
will select the reset configuration with the highest priority in this situation.

PasswordEnforcementConfiguration.description:
A system in a password reset enforcement configuration.  This defines how the system is referenced
as part of the reset configuration and defines the users who have accounts on the system that
qualified for the configuration.

passwordEnforcementId.description: The id of the password enforcement these notification settings are associated with.

notificationId.description: The id of the email notification to send out for password expiry.

smsNotificationId.description: The id of the sms notification to send out for password expiry.

notifyDaysBeforeExpiry.description: The number of days prior to password expiry to send the notification.

expiryNotifyType.description: The type of password expiry notifications.

PasswordEnforcementNotification.description: The details of the notifications sent out on password expiry.

passwordEnforcementId.description: The id of the password enforcement.

systemId.description: The id of the connected system configured for the password enforcement.

visible.description: Flag that indicates the visibility of user accounts in password reset screens.

scramblePasswordOnExpiry.description:
Flag that indicates the password will be scrambled if the password expires. If set, the user will not be able to
use their expired password to access the system.

master.description:
Flag that indicates that the selected connected system is the Master connected system of the password enforcement
configuration.
When the Password Sync Option is enabled, the Master system in a password enforcement configuration will be the
first connected system to get its password reset. If the Master system password reset fails, then reset of all
other connected systems in the password enforcement configuration will be skipped. The Master indicator will be
displayed in all the areas that allow accounts in password enforcement configuration to be selected for password
reset.

passwordEnforcementId.description: The id of the password enforcement.

name.description: The attribute name.

PasswordPolicyAttributeDetail.description: A product attribute whose user specific value should not be used within their password.

attribute.description:
If Type is ExcludeUserAttributes, this is the attribute whose value should be excluded
from use in the password.

type.description: The type of password validation rule.

value.description:
The value associated with the password rule.  For example, the minimum or maximum length
of the password, or what characters should be excluded from use.  The value will be
dependent on Type.

visible.description: Flag that indicates whether the user should see this password rule.

conditional.description:
Flag that indicates whether this rule is part of a quorum condition.  A quorum condition
is one where a minimum number of rules must be satisfied for the password to be considered
a valid password.  For example, 3 out of 4 rules marked Conditional must pass for the
password to be considered valid.

password.description:
The new password to set on the accounts referenced by AccountIds.  If the accounts referenced
by AccountIds are in a system that qualifies for a password reset configuration, then the
password must meet the password content rules defined in the configuration before the password
will be reset.  An error will be returned if the password does not meet the password content
rules if they are configured.

accountIds.description: The ids of the accounts whose password should be reset.

requestorNotificationId.description: The id of the notification to be sent to the requestor when the password is reset.

beneficiaryNotificationId.description: The id of the notification to be sent to the account owner when the password is reset.

PasswordResetBy.description: Specifies who can reset the password.

resyncEnabled.description: Flag that indicates whether password resync should be displayed in the Portal UI

enforcements.description: A list of systems and their password enforcement configuration details.

PasswordResetConfiguration.description:
A system in a password reset enforcement configuration.  This defines how the system is referenced
as part of the reset configuration and defines the users who have accounts on the system that
qualified for the configuration.

The list of features and the permissions associated with each feature that are
assigned to this persona.

Id of contact verification configuration associated with this configuration. If set,
api/user-management/data-verifications/{id}/sendPin should be invoked and the PIN
confirmed before updating the profile.

profileVerificationConfig.description:
Id of profile verification configuration associated with this configuration. If set,
api/user-management/data-verifications/{id}/sendPin should be invoked and the PIN
confirmed before updating the profile.

user.description: The user information that should be used to populate the user's identity.

accessPeriod.description: The start and end dates for the Identity access.

reason.description: The reason why identity access is being requested.

notificationEmailAddress.description: The email address that should be used to send notifications about the access request.

SelfRegistration.description: Details of a self registration request.

startDate.description:
The date when the new user should be given access. The date must be equal to today or in the future as dates in the
past will not be accepted.

endDate.description: The last day the user should have access.  If null, access is permanent.

SelfRegistrationAvailability.description: Details of the self registration availability period.

registrationEmailDisplay.description:
Inform the ui whether to show an input field for an e-mail address so that notifications can be
sent to this address to inform the user of their registration status.  If the value is hide, then
notifications most likely won't be sent.

submitCommentDisplay.description: Inform the ui as to whether a reason for the request must be entered as part of the registration process.

managerSearchFilter.description:
If the user can select a manager as part of self registration, this contains the filter that
should be used to limit the user's manager selection.
managerSearchFilter.example: filter=Person-Firstname sw Jo and Employee-Email1 co abc

requestForInformationEmailAttributeName.description: The product attribute that contains the email address that should be used for request for information requests.

showPasswordPolicy.description:
If a password is one of the self registration fields they must fill out, then this property
directs the ui to show the password policy so that the user may enter a valid password.

attribute.description:
The attribute that holds the new user type value.  Changing the value of this attribute
will typically change the dynamic profile screen that is displayed to gather the new user profile
information.

userTypes.description:
A list of possible new user types.  For example, employee versus contractor.  Or student versus teacher.
Each type can have its own profile information screen, approval rules, pre-process workflow, post-approval
workflow, submission message, and other properties.  The Value property of the NewUserType selected should
be stored in the profile attribute represented by the NewUserAttributeTypeName.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the self registration feature is enabled or not.

priority.description:
Password enforcement configurations are created with an assigned priority. Password
policies in higher priority enforcement configuration will be set as the enforced password policy
when a user qualifies for multiple enforcement configurations. Two password enforcement
configurations cannot have the same priority. Priority value range is from 1 to 100 with 100 as the
highest priority.

syncPassword.description:
Flag that indicates that, if the connected systems account of a user in a password enforcement have a common
password.

mutuallyExclusive.description:
Flag that indicates that the end user cannot use the same password to reset connected system accounts belonging to
different enforcements.

notifyDaysAtSelfServiceLogin.description: Notify user that the password is about to expire X day(s) before expiry at Self-Service login.

description.description: Description of the password enforcement. This is a locale aware property.

displayName.description: Display name of the password enforcement. This is a locale aware property.

enabled.description:
Flag that indicates if the password enforcement is enabled. Only enabled enforcements will be
evaluated during the password enforcement evaluation for a user.

name.description: Name of the password enforcement.

SelfRegistrationPasswordEnforcement.description: Details of the self registration password enforcement.

changeType.description: The action (add/modify/delete/change...) that should be performed.

selfRegistrationConfigId.description:
The id of the self registration configuration that was used to make the request if
Type is SelfRegistration.

beneficiaries.description: The users for whom the request is for.

newUser.description: Flag that indicates that the beneficiary is a new user.

cancelable.description:

when they are pending approval.

permanentEndDateAllowed.description:
Flag that indicates whether permanent end dates are allowed. Used to control whether approvers
may change the access end date if they are allowed to modify the request.

maxDuration.description: Maximum account duration in days.  0/null means no restriction.

resources.description: The list of resources to be acted upon (add/modify/remove) for this user.

userTypeId.description: The id of the user type configuration that should be used to send the notification.

sendToAttributeId.description: The id of a verified attribute that the notification should be delivered to.

substitutionValues.description:
The substitution variables and values that should be inserted into the notification
before its sent.  This must contain a variable named 'PORTAL_URL' whose value
is a URL that the FAM server should redirect to when the user clicks on the link
in the notification.

{
"Identity-Claimed": false,

}
